ShouldersLVLateralRaise.name: Lever Lateral Raise
ShouldersLVLateralRaise.preparation: Sit in machine. Situate bent arms between padded lever and sides of body. Grasp handles if available.
ShouldersLVLateralRaise.execution: Raise arms to sides until upper arms are horizontal. Return and repeat.
ShouldersLVLateralRaise.comments: If necessary, lean forward slightly to keep elbows directly lateral to body. Also see alternative machine.

ShouldersLVExtendedArmLateralRaise.name: Lever Extended Arm Lateral Raise
ShouldersLVExtendedArmLateralRaise.preparation: Stand facing machine and grasp lever handles to each side with elbows straight or slightly bent.
ShouldersLVExtendedArmLateralRaise.execution: Raise lever handles to sides until elbows are shoulder height. Maintain elbows height above or equal to wrists. Lower and repeat.
ShouldersLVExtendedArmLateralRaise.comments: If elbows drop much lower than wrists, front deltoids become primary mover instead of lateral deltoids. Torso can also lean forward slightly to keep resistance targeted to side delt.

ShouldersLVExtendedArmKneelingLateralRai.name: Lever Extended Arm Kneeling Lateral Raise
ShouldersLVExtendedArmKneelingLateralRai.preparation: Kneel on shin pads facing machine and grasp lever handles to each side with elbows straight or slightly bent.
ShouldersLVExtendedArmKneelingLateralRai.execution: Raise lever handles to sides until elbows are shoulder height. Maintain elbows height above or equal to wrists. Lower and repeat.
ShouldersLVExtendedArmKneelingLateralRai.comments: If elbows drop much lower than wrists, front deltoids become primary mover instead of lateral deltoids.

ShouldersLVLateralRaise2.name: Lever Lateral Raise
ShouldersLVLateralRaise2.preparation: Sit in machine. Situate bent arms between padded lever and sides of body. Grasp handles if available.
ShouldersLVLateralRaise2.execution: Raise arms to sides until upper arms are horizontal. Return and repeat.
